text: If you want to create users In HubSpot using that api is the way to go
I have same experience as Bradley here. When doing hubl it isn’t worth it. Same with chatgpt

If you have access to graphql(in any portal) it might be easier to create a record with one of those properties set up like that and to get all the items from the graphql call to find he property you are looking for
Lol yeah you basically have to tell chatbot you're using jinja and hope it doesn't use functions that aren't available in HubL

Hey <@U25PYL3Q8> - do you have any experience with this? Im looking to guide a customer on the steps they need.

I am a CSM on HubSpot's enterprise team

Without knowing the context of this, I’m unsure how to provide guidance. 

Let’s assume they have some app or outside software that has users in it and at some point they want to create a HubSpot user from there. 

They would need to add an api call that takes those user details and sends them to the user api

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning|https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/settings/user-provisioning>

It is just a simple post api call with the email address. Optional stuff is first and last name. Then you have permissions and teams. I’d advise setting up these in HubSpot, then getting the ids of them through the UI (click on team then get the id out of the url)

This will help assign them to the correct place. 

<https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Create-a-user-using-the-API/m-p/227311|https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Create-a-user-using-the-API/m-p/227311>

If you have something specific to add let me know and I can add more details

Thanks for all the guidance! In this instance, they have users in Workday and in Azure Active Directory.

They would be setting up a net new HubSpot instance.

They want to be able to add those users and assign permission sets from Azure AD to HubSpot

Let me know if this helps!
yeah, they would just need to map how all of this works. Setting up the permissions / teams is important to do this before starting that process
then inside the azure to HubSpot they will need to map permission settings from the azure to how they relate to HubSpot
another alternative would be to group them by email address and then assign them like that
Perfect, make sense. Thanks for the help!!
if they need any help — <http://deckerdevs.com|deckerdevs.com> and I can jump on a quick call wiht them
